page.title: 18A WALK NEAR BAUMBER.
page.content: On the 10/6/85 at 1.33pm at a bearing of 162 degrees we set off on a walk, starting from farmers row.The first thing I noticed was wheat then turning round I saw some Lincoln Reds and near them were some sheep, Border Leister As I was walking down the lane I saw a gap in the hedge then suddenly I saw two stoats hung on a tree.Then I saw some more on the wire .They were there to scare other stoats away and to show the farmer that the game keeper had done his job.As I walked along I spotted some fox droppings which are mainly grey with a point at one end.A bit later on somebody found a black and red froghopper a small kind of insect.Somebody noticed a piece of iron sticking out it was a rabbit trap and there was also a stoat trap.The day ended with a down pour.
